Definition: A class that is a base for extension, and must be specialized to be used directly
Contains only properties from a single external namespace
Represents a specific relationship between objects
Contains no object properties, one or more attribute properties, and exactly one data property that is not an attribute property.  Does not have a special name.
A data property in which `isAttribute` is true
A class that can be augmented with additional properties
Oontain the augmenting properties
Element based on an augmentation type that is substitutable for the augmentation point element in the augmented type.
An abstract element declaration that provides a place for any augmtation properties.
How many times a property may/must appear in an object
Defines the content of a corresponding object (or resource) in a message.
A restriction in which each value that is valid for the datatype corresponds to a code value in a code list.

A list of distinct conceptual entities, each represented by a code value that has a known meaning beyond its text representation.  These codes may be meaningful text or may be a string of alphanumeric identifiers that represent abbreviations for literals.
A NIEM representation of the matamodel.
A model including a definition for every referenced component.
A object or type with  child elements.
A class of artifact, such as an interface, protocol, document, platform, process or service, that is the subject of conformance clauses and normative statements.
A requirement on an artifact with respect to its conformance to a conformance target.
A text definition of each component, describing what the component means.
Defines a relationship between an object and a literal value.
Defines the allowed values of a corresponding atomic literal value in a message
A component that is provided, but the use of which is not recommended.
A human-readable text documentation of a component.
A CMF object or XSD schema component that has an associated data definition.
Expresses the additional vocabulary required for an information exchange, above and beyond the vocabulary available from the NIEM model
A set of data that embodies a single concept from an external standard.
A schema component defined by an external schema document.
Non-NIEM-conformant schema documents.
A data concept for a facet that restricts an aspect of a data type.
Material that appears as supporting text, description, and rationales for the normative material.
Defines a methodology, pattern, or procedure for understanding some aspect of an instance of a conformance target.
An object that defines a datatype as a whitespace-separated list of atomic values.

A word, phrase, acronym, or other string of characters that is used in the name of a namespace component, but that is not defined in OED, or that has a non-OED definition in this nameespace, or has a word sense that is in some way unclear.
The data in an information exchange
A person that creates a message type and format from an information requirement, so that a message at runtime will contain all the facts that need to be conveyed.
A person that writes software to implement a message specification, producing or processing messages that conform to the message format.
A XSD representation of a message namespace
A collection of related message formats and types
The mixing of data tags with text
Represents a complete or partial NIEM model.
A collection of uniquely-named components.
A unique URI for a namespace.
A framework for exchanging information among public and private sector organizations.
A set of common objects.
A set of objects that are specific to certain government or industry vertical
An abstract model for NIEM data models.
Required for conformance (e.g. rules).
Represents a class of objects defined by a NIEM model
Defines a subject-predicate-value relationship between an object and another object.
Describes or represents a characteristic or subpart of an entity or concept.
A complex type definition wrapper for a simple type in the XML Schema namespace.
Provide additional context to resolve subtleties between properties of objects.
The class or datatype of a property.
A pointer to an element in a message.
A model of objects, properties, and relationships
Namespaces that include all components in the NIEM model.
An attribute property that contains a reference to an object in a message.
Indicate the style of component, prevents name conflicts or indicates the nature of the value.
Defines a datatype as a restriction of a base datatype plus zero or more restricting Facet objects.
An object or type that has only attributes, not elements.
A collection of NIEM components required for an information exchange.
A subset of the components in a reference or extension namespace.
Defines a datatype as the union of one or more datatypes.
Defines an XML Schema that may be used to validate an XML document
